meanings.definition: A place where a ship anchors.
meanings.sent1: The sailors found calm anchorages in the bay.
meanings.sent2: The harbor had many anchorages for boats to dock.
meanings.sent3: The anchorages were so full that the ships had to wait in line.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of uncertainty, the anchorages of friendship kept me steady.
meanings.sent5: The anchorages of safety provided refuge during the storm.

meanings.definition: The act of anchoring a ship.
meanings.sent1: The quick anchorages of the crew impressed the captain.
meanings.sent2: Proper anchorages require skill and precision.
meanings.sent3: The anchorages were so efficient that the ship stopped on a dime.
meanings.sent4: With each decision, he felt the anchorages of responsibility weighing on him.
meanings.sent5: The anchorages of teamwork ensured a smooth docking process.

meanings.sent1: The anchorages of the ship kept it steady in the storm.
meanings.sent2: The anchorages provided stability in rough waters.
meanings.sent3: The anchorages made the ship feel like a floating fortress.
meanings.sent4: She felt the anchorages of love grounding her in times of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The anchorages of tradition held strong through generations.

meanings.sent1: The anchorages of the building ensured its strength.
meanings.sent2: The anchorages of the bridge supported heavy traffic.
meanings.sent3: The anchorages of the structure were tested in the earthquake.
meanings.sent4: His principles were the anchorages of his character.
meanings.sent5: The anchorages of trust formed the basis of their relationship.
